title: Tamara Ecclestone might stop breastfeeding her baby when she’s four: 'She won’t still be on my nipple at uni'

Tamara Ecclestone caused uproar on social media last week when she shared a picture of herself breastfeeding her daughter Sophia – who’s nearly three years old. 
But appearing on Good Morning Britain today, the 32 year old mum said she released the photo to “celebrate” and “normalise” breastfeeding. 
And the mum of one admitted that despite criticism that her toddler is too old for breastfeeding, she’s not prepared to stop until she’s ready. 
"I'll never feel uncomfortable about such a natural act. I'm just trying to do my best,” Tamara told hosts Kate Garraway and Charlotte Hawkins. Tamara Ecclestone won't stop breastfeeding until her daughter is ready (Photo: ITV) Kate Garraway and Charlotte Hawkins got involved in the debate (Photo: ITV) 
“Isn’t it the mum’s job to help the child wean off something that she obviously enjoys and teach her maybe it’s time for a cuddle now?” mum of two Kate asked. 
“I feel I am helping her to be independent from me, she goes to nursery, she’s very social she’s very outgoing and I feel by not taking it away from her when she’s not ready, it’s creating independence for her,” Tamara answered. 
“What about when she goes to school, we know what kids are like and they will have seen this, are you not potentially exposing her to ridicule when you could be protecting her?” Charlotte asked. 
“I feel like this could never be ridiculed, there are still children I see walking down the road a lot older than her with a dummy hanging out of their mouth and no one would ever say anything and they should not, it’s the parent’s decision,” Tamara answered. Tamara eloquently put her point across (Photo: ITV) 
“I don’t want her sitting on this sofa in twenty or third years time having this discussion and defending her position, when she’s old enough to understand why I did it I know that she’ll believe in me and in the reasons I did it and support me.” 
And when asked when she’ll stop nursing her baby, Tamara said: “She’s not going to go to university and still be on my nipple and apparently the natural age of weaning is about four and a half. She might be done before that she might be done around that time but when it’s right for her is when it’s right for me.” 
Tamara’s open admission caused a mixed reaction from fans – with some praising the mum of one and others dismissing her as “weird”. 
Talking about the public’s reaction to her social media post, Tamara admitted she was prepared for the fuss. 
“I knew I was going to get a reaction because I have posted pictures breastfeeding before,” she said. 
“But I gave it so much thought and I thought it was something that’s so important and that if I want mums in the future – my daughter one day – to not have so much negativity or people questioning breastfeeding and making such a big deal out of it I thought it was really important for me to go ahead and post it.” Like us on Facebook
